title: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: In the XML Report Designer editor, when editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed with the text 'Dirty Page' (including the quotes) and the message 'Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved.' (including the quotes). The user is then required to determine how to either save or discard their changes. The dialog box offers the options 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' with the following behavior: selecting 'Yes' would save the changes, selecting 'No' would discard the changes, and selecting 'Cancel' would do nothing and keep the user on the Source page. Additionally, the dialog box is incorrectly titled as 'Error' (including the quotes).
OB: When attempting to switch from the 'source' view to the Layout view in the XML Report Designer editor without saving the changes, an error message is displayed with the text 'Dirty Page' (including the quotes) and the message 'Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved.' (including the quotes).
EB: When attempting to switch from the 'source' view to the Layout view in the XML Report Designer editor without saving the changes, a clear error message should be displayed, informing the user that they need to either save or discard their changes before proceeding. The dialog box should be properly titled as 'Dirty Page' (without the quotes).
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Attempt to switch to the Layout view.

The error message 'Dirty Page' (including the quotes) should be displayed, along with the message 'Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved.' (including the quotes).
